title: 3 arrested over snatching, sharp weapons recovered at Mohammadpur
body: The police have arrested three people over their alleged involvement in snatching and recovered different kinds of local-made sharp weapons in the capital’s Mohammadpur area. The arrested are Shafiqul Islam, 22, Sharif, 23, and Adar Hossain, 19. Acting on a tip-off, police conducted a drive and picked up Shafiqul and Sharif from Mohammadpur’s Babar Road area on Wednesday evening, said police, adding that the sharp weapons were recovered from a house in Shekhertek area in another drive conducted based on the information they provided. Mohammadpur police station inspector, operations, Mofiz Uddin on Thursday afternoon said that police recovered a large quantity of chapati, Chinese axes, different types of knives, elevator equipment, electronic devices and other things in the drive. In primary questioning, the arrested said that they used the sharp weapons for snatching and then hid the goods in a house, according to police. The police inspector Mofiz said that Shafiqul and Sharif worked under Shahidul Islam, leader of the snatching group. A drive was conducted with those two at Shahidul’s house but he managed to escape whereas Adar Hossain got arrested. A case has been filed against Shafiqul and Sharif with the police station, said Mofiz, adding that legal actions against the arrested are under way.
